CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, National Edition, October 17, 1942, pg. 5, reads: "DRUGGIST ON OLD GOLD BANDWAGON - Here is just one of the many alert retailers who have jumped on the Old Gold "bandwagon" and is taking every advantage of the history-making advertising campaign. Incidentally, one of the reasons for Old Gold's phenomenal sales increase can be credited to the cooperation that the retail outlet is giving both the newspapers that are making a direct appeal to its customers and the Old Gold company.  Standing beside his Old Gold window display is William W. Goode, one of Pittsburgh's leading pharmacist and owner of this popular Wylie Avenue drugstore. - Harris Photo."Cutline for image published in New Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 14, 1976, pg. 34, reads: "Old Goode's Drug Store-Hill District residents remember William W. Goode's Drugstore at Fullerton Street and Wylie Avenue.  Boy didn't he have everything you wanted from a dollar to a penny. And-Look at those prices.  I guess Mr. Goode's facial expression says the same thing.  (Harris Photo)"
TitMainTitle: Three men, including man wearing uniform, and William W. Goode standing outside of his Goode Pharmacy, with large advertisements in window for Old Gold cigarettes, 1303 Wylie Avenue, Hill District
